Abstract

This paper describes how to use the FLExTrans machine translation system. It is a supplement to my master's thesis which goes into more detail on the background and documents a test case. Please see A Linguist-Friendly Machine Translation System for Low-Resource Languages.

1 Introduction

Main sections to read in the thesis to get oriented.

2 FLExTrans Modules

3 Sense Linker Tool

The Sense Linker Tool is a tool for linking source senses to target senses. The tool looks through the text specified in the configuration file and lists every sense that was analyzed in that text in order. Here's sample screen shot of the Sense Linker Tool:

(1)

Here's a key to the color coding:

Color
White Source sense has been linked to a target sense.
Red Source sense has not been linked to a target sense.
Light Blue A target sense has been suggested for this source sense through a partial match of the glosses.
Blue A target sense has been suggested for this source sense through an exact match of the glosses.
Green The target sense has been set or changed for this source sense.
Yellow For this source sense a link will be added or changed in the source FLEx project when OK is clicked.
Red Text There is a mismatch of grammatical category even though the glosses match.

For suggested sense links (colored in blue), if you want to link them, simply double-click on the Link It column. A one means it will be linked. To link a source sense with a target sense where there is no suggestion or to change an existing link, you need to do two things. First, select the target sense that you want to link to in the drop down list of senses () then go to the Target Head Word column for the source sense in question and double-click there. The target sense information should appear with a green background color.

If you only want to see the senses that need to be linked, check the box that says Show Only Unlinked.
